entry.title: UCC hosts 'To Watch the Moon Move' photography exhibition
entry.summary: WINCHESTER — For years, photographer Parker Reinecker has explored the American South, photographing its people and sights to explore the regions economic and social instabilities and unearth its humanity. Now, he's bringing that perspective to the Umpqua Valley.

entry.title: Forest Service, Cow Creek Tribe Expand Partnership To Restore Forests In Southern Oregon
entry.summary: The U.S. Forest Service and the Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians signed a shared stewardship agreement to expand forest restoration across the Umpqua and Rogue River–Siskiyou national forests, focusing on wildfire risk reduction, forest health and protecting nearby communities.

entry.title: Roseburg Warming Center to Open Tuesday Night as Temperatures Drop
entry.summary: UCAN will open the Roseburg Warming Center Tuesday night as cold temperatures reach activation levels. The shelter at St. Joseph’s Catholic Church will offer check-in, a meal and overnight warmth for guests, with check-out Wednesday morning.

entry.title: Emergency Sewer Work To Restrict Access Near Bi-Mart In Winston Starting Feb. 23
entry.summary: Emergency sewer work in Winston will begin Feb. 23, restricting access near Bi-Mart and NW Cary Street. Detours will route traffic to NW Civil Bend Avenue and NW Brantley Drive. The project will replace about 310 feet of sewer main and is expected to last roughly two weeks.

entry.title: Made for Trades Program Turns Dugout Rebuild Into Hands-On Career Training for Local Youth
entry.summary: A dugout rebuild in Douglas County is doubling as hands-on trade training for local youth. Through the Made for Trades program, students are gaining construction experience, earning scholarships and preparing for careers in skilled trades while helping improve a community ballfield.

entry.summary: Sutherlin police are investigating a Feb. 15 robbery at the Offyce Bar after two masked men posing as officers reportedly took cash and fled south on I-5 in a vehicle. No weapons were shown and no one was hurt. Police ask anyone with information to contact SPD.
